instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message:
hi guys,
having a a1502 board, 820-4924.  

machine can't boot into any OS, kind of like the sensing circuit issue slow.
option+D to run ASD and had a result PFF004"there may be an issue with the fan"

I replaced the fan and have the same result.
thought can be the issue with the fan circuit,so replaced Q6060 , and check resistors values on R6061 R6065 R6060,all match the values on schematics.

dont see any spills around the board, doubting if its' a bad SMC now?

any suggestion please?

thank you!

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message: yes of course, the machine can power on ,posts without problems,you can hear chime, see logo, then loading and stuck there.

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message: I dont understand the answer to my question. Yes of course the ROM was messed with?

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message: I meant the rom was there and never touched.  looks very fine to me

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message: sorry about the confusion,thought you said if it was installed

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message: Is the fan spinning up during the hardware test? Is there liquid damage?

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message:
it doesn't spin all the time, but when the test goes like 60% , it spins full speed then slow down later on.
don't see any liquid damage,checked couple times already.

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message:
So it it is able to control the fan. So probably it is not seeing the tacho signal.

Again, was there liquid?? Is it power on from the battery?

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message:
i double check couple times already. all those cycle water testing stickers are all white,not red.
and don't see any red point and corrosion as well. and yes, it does power on from the battery.

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message: Honestly I have no idea what is wrong. A bad fan would not cause it to not boot an OS. This is one of those machines that you need to take to an AASP and have them run AST/MRI on and see which sensor(s) are failing. Apple sucks for not providing stand alone ASD anymore, RIGHT TO REPAIR!

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message:
Exactly!! if we have ASD for this model, way much easier and big chance it can be fixed.
and yes, right to repair man!! THEY SUCK, wanna monopolize the after sale repair, and make the most profit out of people who buy their products.

but people who have the skills should have the right to do it! we should have those info,just like the schematics, I don't mind even paying at a reasonable price.

anyway, I don't think AASP can be an option for me, last step i would take probably will be the SMC, what do you think about that?

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message: I doubt the SMC is the issue, it does not just die. I really have no idea on this besides that you need to run AST on it. Randomly replacing stuff will only make things worse.

threads.title: 2015 a1502 820-4924 ASD ERROR PFF004 "there may be an issue with the fan"
threads.message: alright got you man. thanks anyway!
